body:
Hello @jbrockmendel! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/arrays/datetimelike.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/e0f02db0b09775c69d972ae8e25c2b630cef54f5/pandas/core/arrays/datetimelike.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/datetimelike.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/e0f02db0b09775c69d972ae8e25c2b630cef54f5/pandas/core/indexes/datetimelike.py) !

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23430?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23430?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [de39bfc...e0f02db](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23430?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Looks fine to me.  A couple of points:

* Any performance impact with this refactor?
* For the less initiated, why don't we want to use `_shallow_copy` ?

> Any performance impact with this refactor?

If anything, it removes a level of function-call overhead.  Should not make a measurable impact.

> For the less initiated, why don't we want to use `_shallow_copy` ?

_shallow_copy was implemented in these EA mixin classes to make them play nicely when inherited by their respective Index subclasses.  We are moving away from having these get mixed in, and do not need _shallow_copy in the standalone EA subclasses.
